attributes.action: Stop the felling of healthy Lime Trees on Bawtry Rd & Sunderland St, Tickhill
attributes.additional_details:
For further background info see...

https://www.facebook.com/SaveTickhillsTrees
http://www.doncasterfreepress.co.uk/news/campaign-to-save-trees-from-axe-gathers-pace-1-4623806
https://www.facebook.com/SaveTickhillsTrees/posts/1060746070626165

Our aim is to SAVE THE TREES, deliver the truth and give people a voice to decide their fate. The press release needs more detail to be accurate.  

They were planted for Queen Victorias Jubilee and have lots of life yet!
attributes.background:
In 2012 we campaigned to save the Trees on Bawtry Rd and Sunderland St as DMBC and Tickhill Town Council were making plans to remove them, their reason was 'poor health' of the trees.

No independant survey was done, we made this happen and the trees were healthy.

Planned removal is November 15

rejection.details:
Your petition explains that this is a decision made by your local council.

You can find out how to start an e-petition to Doncaster Council here:

https://apps.doncaster.gov.uk/ePetitions/Default.aspx
